column1: A fantastic opportunity to grow together with one of Myanmar’s most diverse and passionate entrepreneurial groups as they are expanding a fine dining restaurant chain across Myanmar. The first restaurant is strategically located in a beautiful old colonial building in the heart of Yangon and brings new Latin flavours and a high standard of service to the country. The group intends to open 40 restaurants in 5 years throughout the country and is looking for a group restaurant manager to work closely with the Managing Director and the celebrity executive chef to oversee and execute this challenge in a brand new emerging market.
· Taking full responsibility in managing staffs, front of the house services, reservation and catering
· Implement dynamic operational working procedures and make changes when required
· Conduct strong detail analysis of service delivery and identify continuous improvements
· Invest time and energy in the management and development, and motivation of the team in a manner to ensure highest quality and bring value for money
· Report directly to Managing director and Executive Chef
· Be willing to work late at night on Friday and Saturday and travel within the country expanding restaurants across Myanmar
· Organise large volumes of work for both yourself and the team, work to tight deadlines when necessary and produce service excellency under pressure
· Minimum 6 years of experience in restaurant management is required
· Must be a result focused leader with the ability to demonstrate innovation and driven by passion in food and beverage. A wealth of staff and change management experience is preferred.
· Must be able to operate without or with minimal input from senior management
· Be flexible, detail oriented and gain respect from staff
· Must possess excellent communication skills and speak fluent English - basic understanding of Burmese is a credit
· Having experience in property development, finance and marketing will be of a great advantage

column2: • prefer expats from Thai or English speaking locals who is passionate about food and beverage
• must have experience in fine dining 6 - 7 years
• age doesn't matter, can be around 40 or younger
• must work dynamically and proactive
• need to work on managing staffing, catering, reservation and liasing with marketing department
• currently have 60 team members and 5 investors, Nat is the one working actively
• will have 2 rounds of interview

• need to travel within the countries as the company is planning to expand 40 restaurants by 2020; 2 more humming birds serving Latin American food in Yangon, and the rest across the country - Mandalay, Nay Pyi Daw, Myitkyeena - might serve different food
• maximum salary - 4,000 USD per month
• no expat package or accommodation, can pay for rent and later on deduct from salary
• prefer who has done property development, good at finance and marketing
• will have to report only to Executive Chef & Nat
• don’t want candidate from hotel industry as they have to go through too many reporting steps
• have to work late at night on Friday and Saturday, and the rest of the week is flexible
• must be detailed oriented and gain respect from staffs adapting local culture
• no degree required
• avoid headhunting from Gekko, Union and Parami Pizza as Nat has worked there before
• if possible, wants Charlie from Mojo
• position to be filled as soon as possible

column1: CAO should set-up and enforce accounting policy, in addition to working with other departments to develop positions on best practices throughout the Group in terms of cash-flow and tax optimization. • Perform full set of accounts and ensure timely closing of accounts, coordinates monthly closing process;

• Prepare financial statements and other reports to summarize and interpret current and projected financial position. Ensure integrity of all financial information within Group;

• Provide cost effective cooperation with accounting advisors and auditors.

• Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance from a respected institution;
• Public accounting background, and minimum of 1-year relevant experience of financial & management accounting particularly in retail banking or consumer finance industry at well-reputed companies;

• Relevant experience in audit and costing is advantageous;
• Excellent strategic planning skills and able to interact with all levels;
• Good MS Office skills particularly strong capabilities in MS Excel;
• Relevant experience in working with accounting/GL system is highly regarded;
• Able to work independently and highly meticulous;
• Familiarity in IFRS is advantageous;
• English language is at least upper intermediate level (both spoken and written);
• OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES
• GL system implementation and upgrading experience;
• Multi-location and international background is a plus;
• Acquisition target due diligence and integration experience is advantageous;
• Ability to delegate work responsibility with strong interpersonal skills;
• Problem solving and strategizing capabilities;
• Progressive experience leading teams and managing projects;

• Demonstrated ability to build relationships and communicate with peers, subordinates and executive management. Focused on keeping the friendly working relations’ environment. Ready to share experience with colleagues;
• Positive and active social life position. Ready to share hobbies and life interests;
• Open minded thinking. Ready to acquire new knowledge and skills.
